intro: Cankrienia chrysantha, commonly known as the golden cupflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that resemble small cups. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Cankrienia chrysantha plays a role in supporting local pollinators, particularly bees and butterflies.
